website_summaries.verdict: Featuring a wide range of designs, Knotties are far stronger than they look, and will survive its fair share of tugs, fetches, and snuggles.
pros: 2 layers of strongly sewn fabric, and 5 squeakers
Tightly knotted arms and legs for rough playtimes
Available in 2 other animals as well as both large and small sizes

customer_reviews.title: poorly made, fragile and poor customer service.
customer_reviews.text: My 20 pound dog removed a leg in 30 seconds. I don't think the leg was stitched on properly. I asked the seller to replace it and received no response. This is an expensive toy that is suppose to be reasonably durable. It's not. Cheap product and poor service. I threw it in the trash and will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Alistair Zebulon

customer_reviews.title: Very well made but not invincible
customer_reviews.text: 8/4/20 Update: Thankyou hugglehounds for reaching out and replacing our pink bunny. We are truly appreciative and impressed with your customer support 🤗 Original review: This product is as well made as it could possibly get but still my dog took an arm off in 30 minutes after I gave it to her. Good thing even though she got the arm off she wasn’t able to open it up to the inside of the bunny. I am impressed though how really sturdy these are and I like the knots in them. I also like the squeaker, it’s a soft sound not loud and annoying like some others.
customer_reviews.author: Pynkrozez

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, some adjustments could improve
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this toy. As mentioned in other reviews the hair at the top is a weak point and should be removed. It's the first thing my dog started to work on. I cut it off pretty quick but it still partially there and a focus of destructive energies. I have had to see this thing up a few times but I expect that anyways with my dog. I wish the main squeaker worked better. It lasts but doesn't always squeak. Although it is a great design that doesn't puncture and not work like most. Overall, I like it and so does my dog.
customer_reviews.author: zaftig

customer_reviews.title: Not so durable and dangerous 2
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these based on the claim that they were tough and durable. Before I read the fine print on the package I gave it to my Havanesse puppy. With in 5 minutes he chewed the arm off and was eating the stuffing. Sure enough. like it says in the fine print he regurgitated and was very upset. I think it should be clearer in the purchasing info that this is not really that durable and that these effects can occur.
customer_reviews.author: Carmelo J. Santoro

customer_reviews.title: Bummed
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty disappointed in this product. For the amount I paid I expected more out of this toy. It's discribed to be for aggressive toy players, my dog didn't even have it longer then maybe 2 hours before it was total trash. I even took the time to read reviews in hopes I finally found my furry baby a toy her could have for awhile but I'm just left in complete disappointment now. I picked this one due to her Nick name is bunny so how perfect it was of been had the quality for the toy actually match the disciption of it. I'm pretty bummed out
customer_reviews.author: Courtney bree

customer_reviews.title: Longest lasting toy so far.
customer_reviews.text: My 7 month old German Shepherd took about a week to rip this monkeys clothes off. But too his dismay the next layer was even tougher. After about two weeks the monkey was a quadriplegic, arms and legs everywhere. The body and head, although stripped of it's outer layer, was not bleeding stuffing or squeaker. Now he has five toys that squeaked. "Puppy heaven." But alas all things must end. All that's left in one arm and a wore out squeaker. It lasted just over 3 weeks. A record for Schnaps. Tough toys that I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: William V. Doyle

customer_reviews.title: Well loved
customer_reviews.text: Our dog loooooves the raccoon. However it didn’t last a month. That’s longer than other soft toys, so maybe that’s great. I did buy another but can’t see buying one a month forever though. Let’s hope he outgrow the destructive phase! Also purchased the elephant, but it’s not holding up quite as well as the raccoon. I thought the skirt would be the weak link, but that’s holding up well despite the fact that he likes to mouth it a LOT. The trunk is pulling away from the face. I’ve repaired it but not sure it’s gonna hold.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: best for dogs that trash toys
customer_reviews.text: sent this as a gift to visitors who saw My Oreo had 2 huggle hound toys that were NOT trashed....their dog trashes all toys so recommended Huggle Hounds to them and after they left, sent their dog the octopus as a gift. My Oreo has the sock monkey (we call him Socks) and the dragon (we call him Puff) and loves them. We play rough & tug of war nightly with them and all squeakers still work after all this time! (2 years plus!) The corduroy is so durable!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Toodles
customer_reviews.text: My aggressive chewer pulled out four out of five squeakers within a week. It isn't really the toy's fault, that's just how she is. She's got surgical precision and determination on her side and she uses it to extract squeakers and destroy toys... which is great because that means she's not ruining other things like furniture or shoes. We named the unicorn Toodles, but I still wasn't ready to say goodbye when my dog stripped it down to an empty husk. This is such a cute toy.
customer_reviews.author: Library Lady Katie

customer_reviews.title: 13 lb Yorkie killed it
customer_reviews.text: My aggressive chewer is a 13 lb Yorkshire Terrier. Thought this was the answer to our dead toy collection. It sadly was not up to the task. The first squeaker died in the first 24 hours. The other 4 died over the next 48 hours. 3 days and the squeakers were done., Now the 13 lb Yorkie is no longer interested in the toy. No tears or rips, but the squeakers were dead within 72 hours of the dog receiving this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Fernie

customer_reviews.title: So sad!
customer_reviews.text: After reading all of the reviews I had high hopes that these toys would outlast every other one I’ve purchased for my girl. She is a rescue (Pitbull/Boxer mix) and loves to destroy anything and everything lol. I have yet to have found a toy that she hasn’t been able to disembowel or rip apart in minutes. This one lasted less than 10 minutes before she was able to get one of the squeakers out. I am so disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Ezell

customer_reviews.title: The jury is still out
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I thought I was ordering a Kong product when I ordered the raccoon. She has had the toy for a week and so far she has not destroyed it. As an 8 month old German Shepard she is an aggressive chewer with the seeming intent in total destruction. The toy appears to be of good construction. The limbs are knotted cloth where her Kong toy has a thing rope “skeleton”. At this point I cannot give a solid review since it’s been only a week.
customer_reviews.author: BR

customer_reviews.title: I Don't Photograph Well Either! 😆
customer_reviews.text: This toy Elephant is so much cuter than it's picture! I actually bought it by accident. I didn't cancel it because I needed some dog toys and I have a soft place for Elephants. When it came I was so happy. It's very well made, totally cute. The picture made It looK awkward and it absolutely isn't. If you are looking for a nice toy that's well made and, your pet will certainly select it as a favorite, this is it. Don't go by that awkward little picture in the ad.
customer_reviews.author: gwenwalker

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly durable!
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog who can remove the squeaker from most dog toys in less than half a day. She’s persistent and clever about how she tears her toys to shreds. I’ve tried just about every kind of “tough” dog toys there are, and even the best of them, she’s managed to destroy in a week or less. Until, I tried HuggleHounds! These soft toys are the only ones she hasn’t been able to destroy. She’s had the cow toy for about 3 months and other than some minor wear it’s still going strong and she still loves to play with it.
customer_reviews.author: xS7

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long, rips pretty easily
customer_reviews.text: Reviews stated durable toy but after 4 months with low play frequency with out 45lb retriever, the neck ripped open and stuffing came out. Tried to sew it back as my dog loves this toy but repair didn't last long. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: WalterB

customer_reviews.title: Not for aggressive chewers!
customer_reviews.text: Well, this lasted about 1 hour with my Lab. But to be fair, I have yet to find a toy that she doesn't destroy. She just loves everything to death, especially if it squeaks. Still giving 4 stars because she had such a good time with it. Once she got the squeakers and most of the stuffing out of it, I took out the rest and sewed it back together. She still loves it, even though it doesn't talk t her anymore!
customer_reviews.author: TGB

customer_reviews.title: Piranha-proof.
customer_reviews.text: I thought I got a puppy, but now I'm fairly certain it's a piranha in a puppy suit. She's adorable, but destroys everything in her wake. So far, this little bunny has held it's own, even the fluffy poof of hair on it's head. That seems to be her favorite part, but it's so well made that she can't pull it out. She loves her bunny, even if she's unable to destroy it. Color me impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Annie B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for all Dogs
customer_reviews.text: HuggleHounds are a must for all dog owners! I love every single one of their durable dog toys and my dog loves playing with them endlessly. I have purchased 4 or 5 of them now and every one is just as great as the one before! They are so durable and definitely are geared towards puppies who like to bite and chew. They have multiple squeakers in each one to keep your puppy entertained for hours. I have never had any issues with them coming apart and my puppy plays with them everyday. I would highly recommend, especially for those who can't seem to find a durable toy for their puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Monkey cow corduroy toy
customer_reviews.text: The only brand that lasts for my Aussie. Not forever of course but we currently still have body parts and the cow is paraplegic now but he is still having fun with the body! Well made and gives you time to take the squeaker when finally chewed out. Please still always supervise pets with chew toys! The first toy he had when we brought him home was the very small one and now he gets a big one every year for Christmas. We just call all his toys monkeys now lol
customer_reviews.author: Tracy L

customer_reviews.title: NOT for aggressive chewers!
customer_reviews.text: HA! Aggressive chewers? What a joke! I bought this for my 7 month old goldendoodle puppy. She likes to chew everything. But it's not like she's a pit bull with super strong jaws! Within minutes, she had dismembered this thing. The picture shows one of the legs she pulled off the sock monkey in her mouth. Cute, but sadly, a real waste of money. Clearly this is NOT AS ADVERTISED! What a rip off.
customer_reviews.author: Cestbon

customer_reviews.title: Super cute- but poorly made. Lasted 1 day
customer_reviews.text: Super cute toy- it looks likes a similar toy by Kong brand, but its not near the quality. Theres no double stitching or anything durable to consider it to be a "dog" toy vs a childs stuffed animal. My dog, who toys really last- ripped head off in in the 1st day. The fabric itself is super thin. For the price- it should have been better quality. Rip "Juan Claude" literally! lol
customer_reviews.author: Melissa S

customer_reviews.title: The Dog Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: Our Shi-Tzu was just licking this Walrus last night to the point where it was soaked. I got it for him around Christmas and he's still into it. It's good quality, corduroy that doesn't tear easily. The Walrus is funny looking and has 4 standard squeakers in it. It's about 10-12 inches in length. I would like to see the price come down a bit. Thought for the size and quality, it should be no more than $12. I do recommend this for small dogs. It's a good licking/chew play toy that holds up to small teeth.
customer_reviews.author: Code Red

customer_reviews.title: Cute for a few minutes...
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally ordered this toy while searching for a new Knog Knots Toy. The purple unicorn is adorable; however, the quality is missing. Our Knog Knots Toys have lasted our toy poodle 3-6 months each and this Hugglehounds unicorn lost all of its limbs within minutes of arrival. Don't be fooled by the labels of "durable" and for "aggressive chewers."
customer_reviews.author: Gail Hughes

customer_reviews.title: It’s still alive!!!
customer_reviews.text: She is an aggressive chewer and ruins any toy she can! We’ve had this about a week or two and she’s not ruined it. I can’t rate the durability, longevity, and sturdiness yet because she hasn’t been as rough with it as normal. She likes it! We’ve been through 6 highly aggressive chewers toys in the last week - each lasting only minutes! Thank you for a sturdy toy - so far! 02/27/2020 - we have a hole! Not too big! I stitched one shut so only have one. We still love it though!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Becker

customer_reviews.title: Please be cautious when purchasing this item!! Chewed right through item and choked on squeaker.
customer_reviews.text: I am thoroughly disappointed in the item and the description of the item. Dog Toyfor Aggressive Chewers. My dog is not an aggressive chewer. I found him with the plastic squeaker in his mouth and the foot of the toy open. This was about 20 minutes after I gave it to him. He is the sweetest, most docile boy. Please be cautious when purchasing this item!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Schuler

customer_reviews.title: Really strong, yet still floppy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for a larger dog who isn’t really obsessed with tearing apart toys (but is large enough to need something sturdy). This is PERFECT, because it is strong enough to throw around and play fetch with, but it’s still soft and floppy enough for the dogs to snuggle with. There are some of these “tough” type toys that are really strong, but also almost feel “solid” - they loose that floppy, stuffed toy feel. This bunny is adorable and soft enough to the dogs to fall asleep with, while still being strong enough to take the grabbing and pulling that comes from most dogs. I am very happy with my purchase and so is the recipient 🐶!
customer_reviews.author: UnaBellaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: HuggleHounds toys are indestructible and loved by 9 mo old pup
customer_reviews.text: Another great HuggleHound. Tried "Faithful" pink rabbit first. It has out-lasted all of my cockapoo pup's other toys. She literally loves it, caresses it gently with her paws as well as tosses and chews it. So ordered the green frog- she is delighted with it too. So many other toys have been destroyed by her energy but these survive!
customer_reviews.author: S. A.

customer_reviews.title: Great Dog Toy
customer_reviews.text: Very cute toy and I am sure great for most dogs. My dog luvs throwing it around and squeaking it and then she slowly dissects it. She is a pit bull lab mix puppy. She takes the stuffing out of them and then just plays with the carcass that is left. Though my dog continues to destroy them, I continue to purchase them as it keeps her busy. Giving 5 Stars because if my dog wasn’t a monster it would be great toy.
customer_reviews.author: Addict Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Extreme chewer - no fluffy for her!
customer_reviews.text: My boxer mix loves chewing but really hates fluffy fillings. She will rip the crap out of those toys then play with the "carcass". Most toys are gone in 15-20 mins. It did take her two days to rip all the fluffy all over my living room. But she is extremely happy and still flings it all over the place - inside and outside. Would buy again since it has lasted.
customer_reviews.author: LJ Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good for a moderate chewer (Remove the hair tuft)
customer_reviews.text: This toy has lasted about a month and a half but not without causalities. I always immediately cut off the tags and hair tuft on top (seriously why is it there? Dogs immediately try to eat it and the site doesn't say what the hair is made off [I'm assuming plastic] so away it goes) Two arms have been ripped off, but I just sewed the openings closed. These toys are great if you have a sewing machine to fix them up real quick. My 6 month puppy is a moderate chewer and this is the only toy that can be out 24/7, as he finds the weak spots and destroys any other plush toys.
customer_reviews.author: Elou

customer_reviews.title: One of puppies favorite toys
customer_reviews.text: My Bernese puppy LOVES this toy. She only cares about a handful of all her toys, this one is clearly one of them. The squeaker definitely a big reason why she likes it, and it is not too loud or high pitch which is nice. Would recommend for a puppy for sure. She has had it for 3 weeks now and it still looks new.
customer_reviews.author: Syanae

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about an hour
customer_reviews.text: The picture says it all ... Almost. My 44 lb hound had a hole in it after about an hour, after which I pulled out the stuffing and squeaker figuring she'd enjoy the empty shell. I've done this with other toys and the "skins" last a while. Well, those toys also took longer than one hour to chew the initial hole in. Photo was taken about 5 minutes after stuffing removal.
customer_reviews.author: qwertypop

customer_reviews.title: My pup's fav toy
customer_reviews.text: Love the durability - this cow has survived many rounds of tug-of-war, being slept on and carried around by my pup. Easy to wash. Note that my dog is a puppy and will be around 25 lbs full grown, so can only vouch for this toy for a dog of a similar size and strength. So far, it's no worse for wear and I imagine it could withstand the play of a much bigger dog.
customer_reviews.author: pamela

customer_reviews.title: Fairly strong
customer_reviews.text: The only squeaker to work was in the center. Thee others were great for my chewing chiuhuahua. I had to cut them out after she got one. The hair on the doll is nasty. I cut it off. This is the second toy I’ve ordered. The Cordero fabric is durable and it looks good after 2 months. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Caola

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about an hour
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it is just me but 1 have 3 small Yorke dogs and it only took about an hour for them to rip a hole in this and spread stuffing around my living room. I made a cloth patch, shoved the stuffing back in and glued the cloth patch over the tear. I was hoping for a TOUGH toy for the little buggers. This one did not make the cut.
customer_reviews.author: NaplesDave

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR AGGRESSIVE CHEWERS!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to find a toy labeled for aggressive chewers that was so highly rated, only to have my dog destroy this in less than 10 minutes! Despite the "special anti-tear cloth" my girl had the sockmonkey's hand completely dismantled in no time flat... extremely disappointed and do not recommend for dog owners with actual aggressive chewers.
customer_reviews.author: Sacha Allen

customer_reviews.title: BEST EVER!! You will NOT be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first chewie stuffed animal that I have ever purchased for my Portuguese Water Dog that he has not been able to puncture and destroy within minutes. I bought the large size raccoon, and there is only one thing I would suggest changing; similar to the review of the hair on top of the octopus's head. On top of the raccoon's head was as black loop. Having read the review on the octopus's tiny patch of hair that made it a weak point, I cut off the black loop as soon as I got it. My dog LOVES this toy! So worth the money. I will be purchasing a smaller one for him next.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Knudson

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR AGGRESSIVE CHEWERS!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My 16 month old Maltipoo loved this toy BUT his love was shorted lived. After only 6 days my dog had dismembered this toy! The only reason I purchased this expensive toy was the Seller’s advertising, “for aggressive chewers”. Seller’s description is a total misrepresentation and should be removed immediately!
customer_reviews.author: TEG

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Recommend -Dangerous Toy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this dog toy for my puppy that likes to chew because the description said it was made for dogs that were “aggressive chewers”. Within five minutes she had chewed off the black fuzzy fur on the end of the tail. The next day she chewed off the black appliqué spots located on the body of the cow and swallowed them. Luckily she threw them back up before she choked. I have posted a picture to show the appliqué spots missing. This is a dangerous toy for dogs that chew. I would not purchase it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SO cute!
customer_reviews.text: Our puppy loves her Rabby. She got one originally June or July 2019. Carries it everywhere! It was looking a little rough, so we got her a new one for Christmas 2019. One month into 2020 and she's destroyed it! Pulled out stuffing and the sqeeker. She's only a year, though. We have another hidden away for when she gets older.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty tough, but mind the seams
customer_reviews.text: Great tough toy, with lots of dangly bits for a pup that likes to whip his toys around so they fight back! I don’t think it’s likely a dog would be able to the thick corduroy-like fabric on its own, though the leg seems do feel like they wouldn’t stand up to prolonged tug of war. The tuft of fur and small loop on the top of the head we’re unnecessary, and sure enough my dog pulled those off and swallowed them within ten minutes... but overall this octopus feels like it’ll stand up to heavy chewing.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Best toys ever
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are heavy chewers and rough players. They are cane corso so this is expected. So why soft toys cause they love them. They love their bones but love these as well. They can handle my dogs. Yes they do eventually tear. Takes a month or two though. Then when it tears I pull the stuffing out and give them back the.....skin?.....outter layer? And that will last forever. Plus they are generally cheaper here than at the pet store. Won't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: My dogs loved them to pieces
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are notorious toy eaters. I keep looking for something tough enough to hold up to my boxer and pit lab mix. These unfortunately were not it. So very cute love them but the dogs got them on Christmas Day the first one was gone in 24 hours the second one was gone in 48. However they do play tug-of-war with them so this probably isn't a fair review. Seriously they're so cute I would buy them again
customer_reviews.author: Sharon P.

customer_reviews.title: Longer lasting toy
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving 5 stars as this toy lasted my dog 2 weeks before he managed to rip off the arm. This is 13 days, 11 hours and 59 minutes longer than any other toy has lasted! My dog isn’t just a chewer, his number 1 hobby is ripping out squeakers, so I am impressed! I will be ordering another when all 4 limbs are gone!
customer_reviews.author: MrsR

customer_reviews.title: Destroyed in hours
customer_reviews.text: First I bought the raccoon for my puppy, he had it for about a month before he ripped it to shreds. He loved it so much I though I would get him another one hoping the cow would last longer sadly this didn't happen. He had eaten the horns off with a half hour. I read all the reviews about how durable these cute toys were. I have to say I am extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: When in doubt shop

customer_reviews.title: Holds up against aggressive chewers!
customer_reviews.text: We have a major aggressive chewer for a pup and this toy has lasted longer than any other stuffed toy we’ve ever purchased. Normally for Christmas he gets one and it’s destroyed within an hour or so. Rope toys are the only toys we’ve found that will last long... HOWEVER, we are going on day five and this unicorn hippo thing is still going strong! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: S. Andal

customer_reviews.title: German shepherd puppy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4 month old German Shepherd puppy. She is obsessed with this toy and is carrying it everywhere. 99% of this toy seems to be standing up to her chewing. The unicorn horn was torn off in minutes though. She destroyed 3 stuffed toys before this so, fingers crossed, we hope this one stays intact.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: My 8 month old English bulldog had this toy for literally one minute and the red hot was off and all the stuffing came out. Not durable what so ever! Some of the worst stitching by far. Will try to get my money back and not order again
customer_reviews.author: chad wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Very durable for my crazy toy destroying terrier
customer_reviews.text: I'm always looking for a toy my crazy dog won't destroy immediately. I ordered the pink monkey for him and it's actually holding up pretty well. It took him a couple weeks before he ripped open a hand to get a squeaker out. He usually gets those out withing the first day or so. He has still only ripped out 2 squeakers over a month later. And no other holes besides the rips where the squeakers were. He really likes chewing on the knots, which are pretty sturdy. I'm really glad i found this toy for him and will definitely get another whenever he finally murders this one.
customer_reviews.author: brianna espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy
customer_reviews.text: I have two pups that love to chew and it is very difficult to find soft toys that last longer than a day or two. I have been thrilled with this brand. They last a very long time and my dogs love them. They play tug of war with them and love playing with them individually. The corduroy seems indestructible. I highly recommend these toys.
customer_reviews.author: Kittie Caracciolo

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this toy! I have ordered it 3 times cause it makes him so happy! He loves to completely destroy it.it is fairly sturdy and lasts longer than his other toys,but he does manage to break it apart after a few weeks. I keep buying it becase he hates the rubber indestructible toys,and loves this cow!
customer_reviews.author: fish

customer_reviews.title: Made in China...
customer_reviews.text: I specifically googled for dog toys NOT made in China and ended up purchasing 4 of these only to see that the labels clearly indicate the product is made in China... Apparently the made is USA part is sticking them in a bag or box to be shipped...
customer_reviews.author: George Holbert

customer_reviews.title: Longest Lasting Toy Yet!
customer_reviews.text: This is the sturdiest and longest-lasting toy I have ever given my Golden Retriever. He chewed, tugged, and pulled on it for 5 days before he ripped a hole in the head. Usually by day 2 every other toy has met its demise. I think a few stitches to reattach the ear will extend Bessie the Cow's life.
customer_reviews.author: Gail L Cain

customer_reviews.title: Durable and fun for an aggressive chewer!
customer_reviews.text: My australian shepherd puppy has chewed holes in many of her favorite toys within days of getting them, even toys we were sure were durable and would last much longer, however she loves her little monkey and after several months it is still intact! She loves to run around with it and squeak it in her mouth, coax us to play fetch in the house with it, and lays down to chew on it and it has lasted all this time! We will definitely be buying more in the future!
customer_reviews.author: cashope

customer_reviews.title: Not as Cute as before.
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered 2 of these raccoons about 6 yrs. ago and donated one brand new one to charity after my dog passed. My new dog[and the wild raccoons that come to visit at night] love his raccoon. The raccoons are pretty tough on the toy so I purchased a new one. While it still seems durable, it is not as cute as the originals toys.The parts that are supposed to black are grey. I know it is not important since I am sure the animals do not care. I was just disappointed when I opened the package and saw it for the 1st. time.
customer_reviews.author: S.R.L.

customer_reviews.title: we love knotties!
customer_reviews.text: We love the hugglehounds knotties collection at our house. This was our third knottie and we couldn't be happier! These toys are far from perfect, but they hold up much better than others. We do allow our dogs to play with these unsupervised and feel safe in doing so. However, as they play with these toys more frequently it is expected that they would not last as long. Currently these toys last about two or more months in our house- longer if you can sew up a few seam pulls! Compared to other stuffed toys, these hold up. They may be a little pricier than other stuffed toys, but you tend to get what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: LynnTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: HuggleHound toys
customer_reviews.text: Our Aussie loves her HuggleHounds. She plays with them all the time. She chews on them and likes to play fetch with them. She loves the squeaky noises they make. When it gets dirty, I throw it in the washer and dryer, and it’s just like new. Great toys from aggressive chewers!
customer_reviews.author: Texan Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: There are squeaker that a determined dog can get to.
customer_reviews.text: An adorable little toy, but it took my Jack Russell friend less than two hours to find the squeakers. I had to be careful.he did not swallow them when he found them. The good news, however, is that even with holes and without the squeaker he still naps with Mr. Moose. I suspect that with a breed that was not as much of a hunter as a Jack Russell the you would have lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: CC in VA

customer_reviews.title: Strong, well-made toy!
customer_reviews.text: A favorite! My Dalmatian is very rough with her toys. She shakes them vigorously, sometimes throwing them around the room. She also looks for the tiniest thread to see if she can find a way to destroy the toy. The has been unable to ruin her octopus. Sometimes she likes me on the other end. I'm not in favor of playing tug of war, but I have held onto the octopus for her. I just make sure I am holding more than one or two legs. There have been no rips and this toy has lasted for months!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Houlihan

customer_reviews.title: Not durable!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not durable at all for my pup. She is a dog that likes to really tear her toys apart. It took her about 20secs to have a leg torn off and start tearing out the stuffing. I was hoping to maybe get a day out of it. Oh well. Edited to add- they did issue me a refund for the toy falling apart so quickly, so I gave them another star for good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE TOYS
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THESE TOYS! My 5-year-old lab loves plush toys but always manages to tear them up after a week, if they even last that long. These toys have stayed in completely intact even after having them for over a year. They are more expensive but definitely worth it for how long they have lasted and how much enjoyment my pup gets out of them. We have the Racoon, Moose, and Duck and will probably add another sometime :)
customer_reviews.author: Marlie

customer_reviews.title: Not for aggressive chewers
customer_reviews.text: The cow was really cute. My medium sized dog with a narrow jaw loved tearing it apart. Within 45 minutes the cow was but a snow drift of synthetic fluff across the living room floor. Probably a nice toy for a regular chewer. Still three stars for once being a really cute cow.
customer_reviews.author: M Moseley

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased toys just like this one and they are still lasting after months of my dogs playing with them. This product was poorly made and my dogs tore it up within one day of having it. The other similar toys are still intact and I have even put them in the washer and dryer. I did purchase the other toys from a store. I will never buy from here again.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Pryor

customer_reviews.title: Great toy!
customer_reviews.text: Did a great job, lasted a long time but was doomed to fail. My Alaskan husky is prone to eat any toy she’s been given and the octopus was no exception. After a good three weeks or so the sad aquatic friend no longer has legs, hair, a squeaker, or any stuffing but is merely a shell of its old body. Regardless, lots of fun having the soaking carcass of this octopus rubbed against my feet!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Cutest most durable dog toys in the WORLD!
customer_reviews.text: Most durable dog toys I’ve ever had. I have a Dalmation who turned two last weekend. It literally takes her 5 to 20 minutes to chew up an average dog toy. I’ve even tried Kong dogs toys because they are supposed to be really durable, they do last about a week with her but these adorable dog toys have lasted a month and still don’t have a single whole in them! I’m amazed at how durable they are! Not only are they durable, they are adorable too! Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Camille  Malek

customer_reviews.title: Not for aggressive chewers
customer_reviews.text: My 5 month old puppy - half lab and half pit - is an aggressive chewer. I only buy toys advertised as such. She loves this toy. The pictures are from the same day that she received the toy. She was able to rip off most of the spots, tear it in 2 spots and chew off most of the tuff on the tail. So while she loved this toy, it definitely is not for aggressive chewers. She also managed to destroy only one of the squeakers.
customer_reviews.author: Cat D.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not worth the money!!
customer_reviews.text: This toy didn’t even last but a few minutes. For $20 I expected a better quality. I purchased some toys from another company for half the price and they’re still intact and squeaking! I’m so disappointed, don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Cassie loves it
customer_reviews.text: Our American Bulldog really is enjoying this toy. It's proving to be very durable as a toss and fetch in the house toy. Surprisingly, she's not bent on destroying it, even though she could easily rip it up if she wanted to. It's made pretty sturdy and the 5 assorted squeakers are cool. We're happy this one is hanging in there as it is a really nice thing.
customer_reviews.author: tomasaki

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves this toy
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves hugglehounds. I think it is the corduroy fabric. He had a large frog which he finally chewed the legs off. - prancing around with them around like a prize! When Mr frog had to retire ( no legs able to be reattached). Rocky came to visit. We have a few of the smaller ones. But my little dog loves the appendages of the larger one. Thank you for making a good toy! Oh and I can put them in the washinging machine !
customer_reviews.author: Loy

customer_reviews.title: Great toy, needs to be stronger
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these as Xmas gifts. As of today both are almost destuffed and/or missing a piece of the body. But my 9 month old basset hound loves the knotted parts to play tug or throw them around. My 9 yr old bloodhound has started the destuffing and removal of the squeaky on one
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Krasnokutsky

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Last a Day
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these after reading how they were made and the claim that they are much stronger then your average dog toy. Purchaed this duck and one of the larger ones. Well within hours my Goldendoodle not only tore an arm off this one, he also swallowed it and he pulled out the stuffing. Same result with the large octopus. Destoyed within hours and pieces swallowed. This may hold up for a dog that isn't a real active chewer, but if your dog has ripped apart stuffed toys with squeekers in the past I'd save your money and not purchase. You will, more then likely, get the same result.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Not for playful dogs!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I decided to take a chance and order this toy for my 8 month old pup. It literally just arrived and right out of the box my pup was super excited. In less than 5 minutes both of the arms have been dismembered and stuffing is all over the floor! Wow...I’ve never seen him do this to a toy that fast hence the one star review.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Great plush squeaky toy.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this toy. I've bought him a couple, the first one lasted for about 6 months before he got it ripped open and all the stuffing out but the squeakers in the feet remained and he loves chewing on them. I bought this one so he would could entertain himself while he was recuperating after his hip replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: cute, tough fabric, but a couple caveats
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two Huggle Hounds now for my 14-year-old mutt (35 pounds) who still loves to squeak and chew. I ordered the large frog, which we both loved. The fabric is tough, and he's adorable, but after a month the squeaker no longer squeaks. I ordered the small cow next, and it's just simply too small. The squeaker is hard to find, and quiet, I think simply because the toy is tiny. I love the design, and the fabric is tough, but... Since I think these have high potential, I will try one more time with a large cow, to see if we can get a longer lifespan.
customer_reviews.author: Jane in Cape Elizabeth ME

customer_reviews.title: Love the toy, HATE the undurability.
customer_reviews.text: My 2 miniature dachshunds absolutely loved this toy. However, it was destroyed in 3 hours. All the legs pulled off in 2 hours. Squeaker in head gone by end of day. This toy is pricier than most and I hoped and expected it to last at least a week.
customer_reviews.author: Eve London

customer_reviews.title: A Winner
customer_reviews.text: For my golden it’s all about the squeakers. When a toy goes silent he loses interest. This toy has lots of them so will keep his interest for a long time. Not annoyingly loud so we can all tolerate it. It also does fine in the washer and dryer. A winner!
customer_reviews.author: MHiggy

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This toy is cute, soft, and squeaky.....but seriously NOT for power chewers. It arrived today and didn’t even survive 5 minutes against my 80 pound Redbone.
customer_reviews.author: Greta Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Cute, dog will love. Not durable, size misleading
customer_reviews.text: Loved how cute the stuffed animal is, only area that is study is where its knotted. My dog took all stuffing out in 10 min of getting it. But he still loves it. Pictures misleading, not as big as pictured when they put up against small ones The options should be small and medium, not small and large, ours is medium.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I like this toy because it's similar to the kong knot toys we have. For my superchewer who destroys plush toys in seconds, she doesn't really have much interest in tearing these ones apart for some reason! If she did decide to tear it apart I don't know how it would fair - but it does hold up really well when my two dogs play intense tug of war.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Scarlett

customer_reviews.title: Great for rough dogs
customer_reviews.text: Usually plush toys die within the hour at our house but these have held up for 6 months! They've definitely become the kids favorite toys and have been chewed on, carried around, used for tug of war and shaken like crazy with minimal damage!! Wicked impressed with Hugglehounds and will definitely buy knotties again!
customer_reviews.author: Addie15

customer_reviews.title: So cute!! My dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This cow looks just like the picture. It’s so cute! My golden retriever who tears through any toy within days has had the cow since Christmas and he loves it. Cow is still holding up. Only one minor tear at a seam and I fixed it already. The squeaker is fun.
customer_reviews.author: amber mcclintock

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't call it "durable"...
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a nice toy but not as "durable" as the Kong rope plushies. My dog had the arms and legs off in about 10mins. The Kong version lasts weeks or even longer. The body/head is still able to be played with but there was no reinforcement to keep it in one piece.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toy a few months ago, and it’s the only plus kind of toy that’s survived my incredibly aggressive chewing terrier mix. He destroys all other toys quickly and easily, but this monkey has been great, and is even still squeaking. It doesn’t have ears anymore, but otherwise is still intact. I couldn’t really ask for a better toy for him.
customer_reviews.author: J1Scarlett

customer_reviews.title: Made for POWER Chewers!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based on reviews! This is just the best toy I have bought my 50+ pound Chocolate Lab/Mix! He loves it, takes it everywhere with him and chews it like crazy! One review suggested cutting the hair off the top and I did that - glad I did. Power Chewer = this toy! Buy It
customer_reviews.author: Terrie

customer_reviews.title: Not a tug toy. Arm came off instantly.
customer_reviews.text: Within minutes of unboxing this toy, our 7mos old large breed mutt had already ripped an arm off playing tug of war with my 5yo daughter. I've stitched the hole back together, but definitely won't be using it as a tug toy any longer.
customer_reviews.author: C. Rosa

customer_reviews.title: Corgi Approved
customer_reviews.text: This was our corgis' favorite toy for years before the local pet shop stop carrying them. These last for months if your dog destroys toys, or forever if they do not pull off the legs. The eight legs make for a great active toy, as anything the dog grabs makes other parts move. That being said, you always have to cut the hair before giving it to the dog. Just get rid of the hair.
customer_reviews.author: Bike Commuter

customer_reviews.title: Toy broke in 10 days :(
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed :( Received this 2/5, my dog chewed through it by 2/14. See attached pics. Did a lot of research for tough durable toys and I had really high hopes for it based on reviews of the toy and the brand. It barely lasted a week and a half! I have medium-sized border collie mixes so I don't even have dogs that are necessarily notorious for being tough on toys. I spent $17 on this toy so I basically spent $1.70 a day for 10 days just so this toy could fail me. Super super bummed out.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Rock

customer_reviews.title: Nice toy
customer_reviews.text: This toy has lasted for a while for my dog. He is pretty aggressive about tearing up toys but this he took apart a little at a time. He continues to play with it. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have bought about 6 Hugglehounds for my little Yorkies. My pups are unusually hard on toys. This toy, like all Hugglehounds, is well made. But even these are no match for my pups.
customer_reviews.author: SuzieQ

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This toy did not last one day with our 1 year old Old English Sheepdog. Our elderly sheepdog (12yrs) likes her "baby," unfortunately young dog chew it up in no time. I spend over $100.00 in toys at Christmas and the only remaining toys are balls.
customer_reviews.author: Meggie

customer_reviews.title: Almost but not as durable as described
customer_reviews.text: So cute but not as durable as described. My chihuahua tore open the feet (hooves) within a day and removed the squeakers. It took another week to get all the stuffing out of its head. However, the middle squeaker still works and for that alone, I will buy another next time I'm shopping for dog toys for my manic pup!
customer_reviews.author: mimilj

customer_reviews.title: Question on durability and longevity for aggressive chewers
customer_reviews.text: I have a very aggressive chewer, a seven month golden retriever who loves her toys. However in two days of receiving her beautiful monkey toy, she has torn it up tremendously. I thought this would be something good for her to have long-term.
customer_reviews.author: CatMS

customer_reviews.title: Strong enough to tug with
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought a couple of this same one a few times. Some lasts over a month before getting ripped and some lasts a week before the first rip but generally brute pretty good and the seams are strong where we can tug and pull with him without limbs ripping off unless he’s chewed through the body already~
customer_reviews.author: lovetoread

customer_reviews.title: Cute but Easily Destroyable
customer_reviews.text: Well it’s a great looking stuffed animal! My dog walked around with it like it was her baby. Then a few hours later, it was absolutely destroyed. No legs or arms anywhere. It was left with a head and a body. Destroyed in no time
customer_reviews.author: Anony Mous

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love Hugglehounds!
customer_reviews.text: My sister bought Hugglehound ducks for my dogs and for my brother’s. They loved them! I bought this octopus for my niece’s dog and he loves it. The toys are well made as evidenced by our dogs who like to chew. You can’t go wrong with this toy.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: The toy is made with good quality materials. My dogs chose to spend hours playing tug of war and the pupoy chewed on it. After a couple weeks of that it has a hole. However, I don't feel their choice of play was that which as intended for the toy
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: I only had this for almost three weeks. My bullboxer is very strong. This didn’t last either. Everytime she tears up and I have to sew it. She’s only a year old. I’m very disappointed. I’ve tried other toys that’s even a number 9 that’s supposed to be tuff and strong...doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Kymmie

customer_reviews.title: Havent you spent 10 dollars on yourself for an hour of fun?
customer_reviews.text: My dog absolutely went crazy for this toy! He was so happy when I got it out of the box. I’m so sad that it didn’t last as long as I had hoped. I’m sure for a regular dog this would be amazing and last a long time, but for my 10 month old Rottweiler, who is over 100lbs, this was just a fun hour. It was definitely worth it for the time he had it though.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Vance

customer_reviews.title: An absolute favorite and great value.  Sturdy even for the roughest chewers.
customer_reviews.text: “Moo-Cow” as we lovingly call this toy has been a favorite since it arrived. One of the only toys that is not destroyed in the first day it hits one of my pups mouths. This lasted nearly 2 months before the head was chewed off. The rest of the body is still going strong and the go-to for my female.
customer_reviews.author: Emily P.

customer_reviews.title: A durable toy!
customer_reviews.text: My girl is an aggressive chewer and so far I have witnessed minimal damage. Now that she has five "babies" to play with, it is extending all their lives but this seems to endure above and beyond,
customer_reviews.author: freefalldenver

product_meta.title: HuggleHounds Plush Corduroy Durable Squeaky Knottie Dog Toyfor Aggressive Chewers
product_meta.description: Size:Large| Color:RaccoonKnotties are the most durable plush dog toys available, made for dogs and puppies. Made with exclusive Tuffut Technology, a durable two-layer lining on the inside, soft and cuddly on the outside. Natural tugging instincts are satisfied by the soft fabric, knots in the limbs and 5 squeakers. Knotties promote healthy exercise and mental stimulation which makes them a hit with owners, dogs, and puppies of all sizes and breeds. The large size is about 15” long, 7” wide and 5” deep. The small size is about 9” long, 4” wide and 3” deep. All HuggleHounds plush toys can be machine washed over and over.
feature_bullets: Durable Toy With Tuffut Technology Lining For Extra Durability
Knotted Limbs For Puppies And Large Dogs
Great For Large And Small Dogs With Two Sizes Available
Multiple Squeakers In Each Toy To Keep Your Pet Entertained
Plush, Tough, Durable, Squeaky Dog Toys In Unique Characters And Colors

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
